news_header: The US Senate is set to question Robert F. Kennedy Jr. about his health views as he faces scrutiny over his vaccine conspiracy theories and past donations related to abortion access.
news_text: The US Senate is preparing to question Robert F. Kennedy Jr. regarding his views on health issues as they debate his nomination for health secretary by President Trump. Kennedy, a former Democrat who has supported Trump, faces criticism for promoting vaccine conspiracy theories and his past donations to abortion rights organizations. His cousin, Caroline Kennedy, has publicly condemned him, describing him as a 'predator' and criticizing his history of drug use and vaccine skepticism. Kennedy has also faced backlash for his financial interests in lawsuits against pharmaceutical companies and has attempted to soften his stance on vaccines as he pursues political positions.
